Reviews.Title: “The terrace restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: dica_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very nice ambience, outstanding staff (at least the reception team was extremely friendly and helpfull). The Execurtive rooms are the nicer ones, but are located in front of the Galata Tower (loud till late and from early in the morning). The regular rooms face the Golden Horn (outstanding view) but are much smaller. From what they mentioned to us they will undergo a renovation in the next months - it might be worth asking before booking. The gem of this hotel (besides its art deco architecture and interior design) is with no doubt the restaurant on the 7th floor. You have what might be one of the best views in Istambul of the Bosphorus and Golden Horn - one on each side. Absolutely outstanding. If not booking a room there, its worth visiting the restaurant for dinner or having a drink during the sunset...

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra A
Reviews.Content: Great location, write in the heart of buzzing Beyoglu (5 mins walk up to the pedestrian Istiklal Caddesi). We had an amazing room overlooking the Galata Tower. The only downside was that the square is a meeting place for Istanbul's students and was very noisy still the early hours. The restaurant at the top of the hotel had amazing views across the city. All the main attractions were walking distance away (about 20-30mins walking to Hagia Sophia) or a very easy tram ride away from the bottom of the Galata Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: hwt61
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to Istanbul. Previously, we stayed in Sultanahmet area, so on our second trip, we decided to stay in Beyoglu area. Yes, the hotel is right across the Galata Tower. However, walking to the tram line mean walking on steep slope which is not easy. It is about 5mins walk to the start of the main shopping street in Istanbul. The room is dark and it has the damp & wet smell. The lighting is inadequate. The room layout, where they place the tv was all out of synch. The front desk staff are helpful, that make it up for the disappointing room. We will not be staying in this hotel again in our future stay in the city of IST.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Paolo C
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m disappointed by an hotel that could be excellent just with a different attitude of the management. I stayed there twice because of the excellent location in the lively galata area next to the tower and because of the amazing view on the Golden Horn you have from some of the (too tiny) rooms on the backside. Weak point is breakfast when you have everyday the same fixed mixed plate of salami, cheese, nutella accompanied by mini-yogurth and mini-fruit salad. A buffet breakfast would be a more appropriate and waste saving choice. But the weakest one is the irritating management that makes you feel as a walking wallet. The receptionist is thoughtful in convincing you to use the hotel services at extra costs (ie airport transfer or sufi dancers shows) but totally indifferent to any of your complains. On January 1st when there was an electric breakdown and the very noisy hotelâ€™s power unit run from 6 am to late afternoon just under my window none took care of my problem. I had to wake up early and stay out all the day. After a seven nights stay at the end they charged me also some extra money for the night of December 31st for a total bill of about 1.000 euros!

Reviews.Title: “Execellent location!”
Reviews.Author: zimmergasse
Reviews.Content: We found the location of this hotel to be excellent. A quick tram ride over the Galata bridge (or about 15 minute walk) and you were in Sultanahmet with all of the main tourist attractions. A short walk the other way and there were great restaurant and nightlife. It was very nice not to be staying in the main tourist area.The area is hilly, however, which could be a problem for some. We had a room with a third bed which was very large and nicely decorated. The bathroom was fine but it was starting to show some age. Our room on the fourth floor facing the street had great views but was a little noisy at night. The views from the roof terrace were fantastic for breakfast (also nice for a pre-dinner drink). Breakfast was quite good. We did not have dinner there as there were cheaper, more interesting restaurants in the area. The free Wi-Fi work well.

Reviews.Title: “recommendable”
Reviews.Author: monopteros
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated at the Galata Tower place, from which most cafes, restaurants and nightlife in "modern" part of Istanbul are within walking distance. Hotel building has its charm, even though some signs of ageing are present. Room was very comfortable and clean. Breakfast buffet was excellent, and the restaurant had a very nice view. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great ~ Great ~ Great”
Reviews.Author: SuperRay
Reviews.Content: The Anemon Galata is a fantastic hotel located next to one of Istanbul's most famous landmarks, the Galata Tower. I stayed here for one night in early October and I could not be more satisfied with my accomodations, the staff or the location. The room was small but well appointed but it's a boutique hotel so I was willing to trade space for the chance to stay in a fancy non chain hotel. The bathroom was nice sized. Shower, but no tub in the room. The staff could not have been more accomodating to my needs and the location of the hotel was excellent with a buffet breakfast in the hotel's rooftop restaurant included. All in all a great experience at the Anemon hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who asked. One quick side note. If you don't like climbing or walking, or if you want to be close to the main tourist attractions then this might not be the hotel for you. This section of Istanbul where the Anemon Hotel is located is in a very hilly area and although it's right next to the Galata Tower the location is probably two miles or so from the main tourist attractions. The other side of the coin is if you don't want to be near the crowds, then this could be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but noisy and not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: cathburns
Reviews.Content: This hotel would be okay if it didn't charge high prices. Rooms are elegant, but noise in rooms facing the street, until 2am every night, prevented us from sleeping and enjoying our vacation. Be careful to request a room away from the street! Staff were nice, but never brought us breakfast food after we requested it in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice building - average service - location ok but in the modern part of Istanbul -”
Reviews.Author: Maude-Frederic
Reviews.Content: You had booked a suite but the only suite that the hotel has to offer when we arrive was on the ground floor, near the reception desk, without any view (I guess the other suites were booked in advance, most probably by travel agencies, despite the fact that we arrived early morning). We have therefore decided to move to a standard room on the fourth floor. The room was small but stylish. The breakfast on the top floor facing the view is really enjoyable. The service is average. After two nights in this hotel, we moved to another one in the old part of Istanbul, which was more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vevans1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the last leg of our group tour and it was such a treat. The hotel had very good service to all of our guests. Questions were answered quickly and they were quick to help us get to and from our hotel with our luggage. The hotel is located a few steps from "freedom street" with tons of interesting shops, food, and things to do. Right out side the hotel is an ATM, a nice little cafe for resting after a long day, a few convenient stores, a pottery shop, and of course Galata tower which is very pretty at night. The rooms in the hotel are decorated nicely with moldings and paintings on the ceiling that are very pretty and interesting. The curtains were floor to ceiling in the room and were great for keeping the room dark. There was free tea and coffee in the room which was really nice after a long day out walking around Istanbul. In our room we also had a desk a lamp and internet that worked fairly well. The beds were comfortable. The bathrooms were spacious for an older building, they had plenty of towels and they were cleaned daily. The restaurant on the top floor great great views of the city and the Bosporus. I think the breakfast was better than the dinner, but the sunset view was hard to beat. Don't miss the view if you stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, and in a great historic building”
Reviews.Author: tholepin0
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Nice rooms: beautifully decorated, nice mouldings, windows decently sound-proofed. - Location is unbeatable: right by Galata Tower, with breakfast views over the bosphorus, and a short walking distance from Istiklal street (excellent restaurant and cafe options). - Comfortable bed. Cons: - Bathroom was okay, but considering the price it should be "pristine". - Restaurant is very overpriced (but of course who would eat there where Istiklal street is just a couple blocks up the road? ...) All-in-all: - You can't ask for a better location, and the rooms are beautiful too. I just wish I could have afforded to stay there every night...

Reviews.Title: “Good, but...”
Reviews.Author: RainerMaria
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic - a short walk to the nightlife of Beyouglu, and a few steps to the tram that brings you to the sights of Sultanahmet. Some houses in the area are renovated, some are not, and the streets are rather dirty. I am sure that in 10 to 15 years time Galata will be one of the poshiest and liveliest places in the Europe, but it is not there yet. The views are beautiful. The hotel facade is beautifully renovated. It is a pity that the design of the beautiful roof terrace is nondescript. Breakfeast is average, breakfeast service could be more friendly. The bathrooms are ok, but should be in a better state of repair given the prices. As the area is lively, the rooms are not quiet. On balance this is an excellent hotel for a sightsseing visit to Istanbul. Especially, I could not think of a more desirable location - much better than touristy Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Elegant”
Reviews.Author: ithacadiner
Reviews.Content: The Anemon Galata was just what we were looking for - luxurious rooms, friendly staff (they even packed a travel breakfast for us - free! - when we left for a 5 am flight), in a lovely part of town. We had arrived in Istanbul seeking a little Ottoman decadence and didn't find it until we booked the Anemon! Also, the price - 120 E in May - was not too far above nearby places.

Reviews.Title: “Nice area to stay in”
Reviews.Author: Abby110
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here. We were upgraded to the front suite, which was beautiful, but, yes, very noisy because the room looked out on the square. Dogs barking, etc. The service was fine, though we were not impressed with the breakfast. The best part of the hotel was its location, which is away from the more touristy districts yet there were plenty of good restuarants and things to look at and do. You can just go sit out on the square, drink tea and look at the world passing by. A relatively mellow neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Anemon Galata!”
Reviews.Author: KeepOnTravelingUsa
Reviews.Content: We loved the Anemon Galata. It is a boutique hotel that has been refurbished wonderfully. We asked for a room with a view and were given one that looked out at the Galata Tower and beyond to the Bosphorus. It's not close to the historic areas, except for the Galata Tower, but it's so easy to get around this city that wasn't an issue. Plus, we love the Taksim area. We stayed in a suite, so the space was generous, with lovely brocade couches and chairs and a nice bathroom. We were on the floor right below the restaurant, but did not have any trouble with noise -- perhaps a chair scraping along the floor every once in a while? The service was also good. One evening we went to a restaurant in Kumkapi - a row/street of all fish restaurants. The hotel arranged for a certain restaurant for us that provided free transportation to and from the hotel. That was really nice considering how much taxis cost in this city!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but choose the room location”
Reviews.Author: macmoud
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Galata at both the beginning and the end of our two-week tour of Turkey and on both occasions were assigned the large suite at the front of the hotel. The reviews you read regarding its ambience, charm and the beatitudes of its restaurant and helpfulness of the staff are accurate; however, if your room like ours faced the street, I would recommend that you take either a strong sedative or inject the best ear plugs you can find before hitting the feathers. The street noise including a pack of dogs who bark incessantly kept us awake most of the nite. If you can, insist on a room at the back but first check to make sure it isn't one of the shoebox sized rooms our friends were subjected to. Barry, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: ParisJetsetter1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem. Located just a ten minute walk from Taksim and Istiklal street -- Istanbul's fashionable and frenetic shopping street -- it combines refined comfort with reasonable prices and a friendly staff. I have stayed here more than ten times and have never been disappointed. The highlight is the rooftop terrace which has a 360 degree view of the Istanbul skyline, including the Golden Horn. You will find a mix of tourists and local glitterati hanging out there. Be sure to wake up in time for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “magnificent view”
Reviews.Author: johannamva
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at the Anemon Galata and overall we enjoyed our stay there. This boutique hotel has been sympathetically restored in the Italian Art Nouveau style( I think),located next to the Galata Tower and across the Bosphorous from the more touristy Sultanhamet district. Some of the out lying area surrounding the hotel is scuzzy but not dangerous. As a cook I particularily liked this district of Instanbul as the restaurants are superior to those in Sultanhamet.The Sultanhamet area is easily and cheaply reached by cab or as we preferred to walk across the Galata Bridge. We found the hotel service staff to be efficient and professional. Breakfast which is included was good with a selection of Turkish and Continental fare.Housekeeping throughout the hotel was good and for the most time our room was made up in good time ,only late once. The best feature of the Galata Hotel is the roof top restaurant' s magnificent view of Istanbul with its many mosques ,considered to be the best view in Istanbul. Generally a good value elegant little hotel with very nicely appointed furniture,marble and ceilings which attracts Turkish and European business guests. The only complaint of any note was a noise issue, our room was located on the floor just below the roof top restaurant / bar and we would be awakened by the shuffling of furniture etc. at 2 am and at 7 am.

Reviews.Title: “the right place”
Reviews.Author: basbasbas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a nice and very convenient location and the restaurant has a wonderful view. The rooms are not big but very nice decorated and not kitch. The stuff was very friendly and helpful. 100 euros a night was the price for double room breakfast and taxes included. Very happy for our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Rather happy”
Reviews.Author: viaggiando
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel after a not so happy experience in Sultanhamet. I found that this hotel provides better value than most hotels I saw in Sultanhamet. Rooms are very nicely appointed, they have all amenities including slippers and bathrobe, and the breakfast terrace has probably teh best view in Istanbul. Nevertheless, I have mixed feelings about the area. It is central and you can go very easily to Sultanhamet with the tram. It has the advantage of keeping you away from carpets sellers and tourist touts, and it is close to good dining options . However, the area is really shabby - probably not so dangerous, but dirty and rather depressing. If you can put up with that, this is a good option. Just pay attention to the minibar, very expensive, and to the astronomical bill for telephone calls (8 YTL for a call of two minutes to a Turkish mobile phone!).
